data.title: QBBS/tih at master · nedry/QBBS
data.meta_description: A Ruby Based BBS. Contribute to nedry/QBBS development by creating an account on GitHub.
data.text:
%B;Today is January 1st, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;HAPPY NEW YEAR

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1449 %C;Lorenzo de'Medici (The Magnificent) of Florence

%C; In %R;1735 %C;Paul Revere

%C; In %R;1752 %C;Elizabeth Griscom (Betsy) Ross, flag maker

%C; In %R;1879 %C;E.M. Forster, English novelist (Howard's End, A Passage to India)

%C; In %R;1883 %C;Kahlil Gibran, writer

%C; In %R;1895 %C;J Edgar Hoover, Mr FBI

%C; In %R;1909 %C;John Glenn, astronaut

%C; In %R;1919 %C;J. D. Salinger, author of 'Catcher in the Rye'.

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1801 %C;United Kingdom of Great Britain & Ireland established

%C; In %R;1801 %C;Giuseppe Piazzi discoved 1st asteroid, later named Ceres

%C; In %R;1863 %C;Emancipation Proclamation issued by Lincoln.

%C; In %R;1892 %C;Brooklyn merges with NY to form present City of NY

%C;Ellis Island became reception center for new immigrants

%C; In %R;1901 %C;Commonwealth of Australia established

%C; In %R;1902 %C;First Rose Bowl game held in Pasadena, California.

%C; In %R;1912 %C;First running of SF's famed "Bay to Breakers" race (7.63 miles)

%C; In %R;1934 %C;Alcatraz officially becomes a Federal Prison.

%C; In %R;1958 %C;European Economic Community (EEC) starts operation.

%C; In %R;1971 %C;Cigarette advertisements banned on TV

%C; In %R;1974 %C;Pioneer 10 passes Jupiter (first fly-by of an outer planet).

%C; In %R;1984 %C;AT & T broken up into 8 companies.

%C; In %R;1986 %C;Spain & Portugal become 11th & 12th members of Common Market

%

%B;Today is January 2nd, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;Betsy Ross Day

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1920 %C;Isaac Asimov, scientist-writer, The Laws of Robotics

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1776 %C;First American revolutionary flag displayed.

%C; In %R;1788 %C;Georgia is 4th state to ratify US constitution

%C; In %R;1893 %C;World's Columbian Exposition opens in Chicago

%C; In %R;1921 %C;DeYoung Museum in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park opens.

%C; In %R;1936 %C;First electron tube described, St Louis, Missouri

%C; In %R;1959 %C;USSR launches Mechta, 1st lunar probe & artificial in solar orbit

%C; In %R;1968 %C;Dr Christian Barnard performs 1st successful heart transplant

%C; In %R;1972 %C;Mariner 9 begins mapping Mars

%C; In %R;1892 %C;J.R.R. Tolkien, the REAL Lord of the Rings.

%C; In %R;1905 %C;Ray Milland, actor (Dial M for Murder, The Lost Weekend)

%C; In %R;1909 %C;Victor Borge, pianist, comedian, Denmark

%

%B;Today is January 3rd, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;Congress assembles, according to 20th amendment to constitution

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R; 106 %C;Cicero, Roman statesman

%C; In %R;1543 %C;Juan Cabrillo, discoverer of California

%C; In %R;1840 %C;Father Damien, helped the lepers in Hawaii.

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1521 %C;Martin Luther excommunicated by Roman Catholic Church

%C; In %R;1777 %C;Washington defeats British at Battle of Princeton, NJ

%C; In %R;1852 %C;First Chinese arrive in Hawaii.

%C; In %R;1870 %C;Brooklyn Bridge begun, completed on May 24, 1883

%C; In %R;1888 %C;1st drinking straw is patented.

%C; In %R;1957 %C;First electric watch introduced, Lancaster Pennsylvania

%C; In %R;1959 %C;Alaska becomes the 49th state.

%C; In %R;1977 %C;Apple Computer incorporated.

%

%B;Today is January 4th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;National Trivia Day.

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1581 %C;Bishop James Ussher, calculated that earth began Nov 23, 4004 BC

%C; In %R;1643 %C;Sir Issac Newton

%C; In %R;1785 %C;Jacob Grimm, German librarian, philologist, fairy tale collector

%C; In %R;1809 %C;Louis Braille, developed reading system for the blind.

%C; In %R;1813 %C;Sir Issac Pitman, shorthand inventor

%C; In %R;1838 %C;Charles Stratton (alias General Tom Thumb, famous short person)

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1754 %C;Columbia University openes

%C; In %R;1784 %C;US treaty with Great Britain is ratified

%C; In %R;1790 %C;President Washington delivers first "State of the Union" speech.

%C; In %R;1896 %C;Utah becomes 45th state

%C; In %R;1948 %C;Burma gains independence from Britain (National Day)

%C; In %R;1959 %C;Soviet Luna 1 first craft to leave Earth's gravity

%C; In %R;1982 %C;Golden Gate Bridge closed for the 3rd time by fierce storm.

%

%B;Today is January 5th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;Twelfth Night, end of Christmas season

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1592 %C;Shah Jahan, Mughal emperor of India (1628-58), builder of Taj Mah

%C; In %R;1779 %C;Stephen Decatur, early American Naval hero

%C; In %R;1846 %C;Rudolf Eucken, German Idealist philosopher (Nobel 1908)

%C; In %R;1855 %C;King Camp Gillette, inventor of the safety razor

%C; In %R;1876 %C;Konrad Adenauer, German Chancellor

%C; In %R;1882 %C;Samuel Rayburn, Speaker of the House (1940 - 1957)

%C; In %R;1895 %C;Jeannette Piccard, balloonist, Episcopal priest

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1809 %C;Treaty of Dardanelles was concluded between Britain & France

%C; In %R;1911 %C;San Francisco has its first official airplane race.

%C; In %R;1933 %C;Work on Golden Gate Bridge begins, on Marin County side.

%C; In %R;1969 %C;USSR Venera 5 launched. 1st successful planet landing - Venus

%C; In %R;1972 %C;NASA announces development of Space Shuttle

%

%B;Today is January 6th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;Feast of Epiphany (Twelfth Night of Christmas in England)

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1883 %C;Khalil Gibran, Lebanese mystic poet (The Prophet, Broken Wings)

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1663 %C;Great earthquake in New England

%C; In %R;1838 %C;First public demonstration of telegraph, by Samuel F. B. Morse

%C; In %R;1914 %C;Stock brokerage firm of Merrill Lynch founded.

%C; In %R;1941 %C;FDR names 4 freedoms (speech, religion; from want, from fear)

%C; In %R;1942 %C;First around world flight by Pan Am "Pacific Clipper"

%

%B;Today is January 7th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1412 %C;Joan of Arc, martyr

%C; In %R;1811 %C;Charles Sumner, leading Reconstruction Senator

%C; In %R;1823 %C;Gustave Dore, illustrator (Inferno, Rime of Ancient Mariner)

%C; In %R;1854 %C;Sherlock Holmes, according to Arthur Conan Doyle

%C; In %R;1871 %C;Aleksandr Scriabin, Russian composer

%C; In %R;1878 %C;Carl Sandburg, poet, biographer of Lincoln (The People, Yes)

%C; In %R;1880 %C;Tom Mix, silent screen cowboy actor (Dick Turpin)

%C; In %R;1911 %C;Butterfly McQueen, actress (Gone with the Wind)

%C; In %R;1935 %C;Valeri N. Kubasov, Soviet cosmonaut (Soyuz 6, 36, Apollo-Soyuz)

%C; In %R;1942 %C;Vasily Alexeyev, world champion weight-lifter

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1558 %C;Calais, last English possession in France, retaken by French

%C; In %R;1610 %C;Galileo discovers 1st 3 moons of Jupiter, Io, Europa & Ganymede

%C; In %R;1714 %C;The typewriter is patented (it was built years later)

%C; In %R;1785 %C;1st balloon flight across the English Channel.

%C; In %R;1822 %C;Liberia colonized by Americans

%C; In %R;1929 %C;"Tarzan", one of the first adventure comic strips appears.

%C; In %R;1963 %C;First Class postage raised from 4 cents to 5 cents.

%C; In %R;1968 %C;First Class postage raised from 5 cents to 6 cents.

%

%B;Today is January 8th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1800 %C;Millard Fillmore, 13th President of the United States

%C; In %R;1587 %C;Johannes Fabricius, Dutch astronomer who discovered sunspots

%C; In %R;1823 %C;Alfred Russel Wallace, codiscoverer of evolution

%C; In %R;1862 %C;Frank Nelson Doubleday, publisher & founder of Doubleday & Co.

%C; In %R;1867 %C;Emily Balch, US sociologist, feminist, pacifist (Nobel 1946)

%C; In %R;1868 %C;Sir Frank Dyson, proved Einstein right: gravity bends light.

%C; In %R;1891 %C;Walther Bothe, German subatomic particle physicist (Nobel 1954)

%C; In %R;1912 %C;Jose Ferrer, actor, director (Cyrano de Bergerac)

%C; In %R;1935 %C;Elvis Presley, singer.

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1815 %C;Battle of New Orleans, made a hero out of Andrew Jackson (the

%C;War of 1812 had ended on 12/24/1814, but nobody knew that).

%C; In %R;1880 %C;The passing of Norton I, Emperor of the US, Protector of Mexico

%C; In %R;1932 %C;Ratification of present San Francisco City Charter.

%C; In %R;1935 %C;Spectrophotometer patented, by AC Hardy

%C; In %R;1958 %C;Cuban revolutionary forces capture Havana

%C; In %R;1968 %C;US Surveyor 7 lands near crater Tycho on moon

%C; In %R;1973 %C;USSR launches Luna 21 for moon landing

%

%B;Today is January 9th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Today is special because...

%C;Volunteer Fireman Day

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1728 %C;Thomas Warton, poet laureate of England (Pleasures of Melancholy)

%C; In %R;1870 %C;Joseph B. Strauss, civil engineer, builder of Golden Gate Bridge

%C; In %R;1901 %C;Chic Young, creator of the "Blondie" comic strip.

%C; In %R;1904 %C;George Balanchine, dancer-choreographer

%C; In %R;1908 %C;Simone de Beauvoir, French author (The Mandarins, The Second Sex)

%C; In %R;1913 %C;Richard M. Nixon, 37th President (1968-1974) Beloved by Checkers.

%C; In %R;1914 %C;Gypsy Rose Lee, burlesque entertainer, actress

%C; In %R;1941 %C;Joan Baez, folk singer, human rights advocate in Staten Island

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1788 %C;Conneticut becomes 5th state

%C; In %R;1793 %C;Jean Pierre Blanchard makes 1st balloon flight in North America

%C; In %R;1799 %C;1st income tax imposed, in England.

%C; In %R;1839 %C;The daguerrotype process announced at French Academy of Science

%C; In %R;1839 %C;Thomas Henderson measures 1st stellar parallax Alpha Centauri

%C; In %R;1847 %C;First San Francisco paper, 'California Star', published.

%C; In %R;1848 %C;Caroline Herschel, "1st lady of astronomy," dies at 98 in Germany

%C; In %R;1978 %C;Commonwealth of Northern Marianas established

%C; In %R;1982 %C;5.9 earthquake in New England/Canada; last one was in 1855.

%

%B;Today is January 10th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1738 %C;Ethan Allen, Revolutionary War fighter (led the Green Mtn Boys)

%C; In %R;1877 %C;Frederick Gardner Cottrell, invented the electrostatic

%C;precipitator, used for pollution control and air ionizers.

%C; In %R;1904 %C;Ray Bolger, dancer, actor (Once in Love with Amy, Wizard of Oz)

%C; In %R;1910 %C;Galina Ulanova, Russian ballerina

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1776 %C;"Common Sense" by Thomas Paine is published.

%C; In %R;1840 %C;The Penny Post mail system is started.

%C; In %R;1863 %C;1st underground railway opens in London.

%C; In %R;1945 %C;Los Angeles Railway (with 5 streetcar lines) forced to close.

%C; In %R;1946 %C;UN General Assembly meets for first time

%C; In %R;1946 %C;US Army establishes first radar contact with moon. It's there.

%C; In %R;1949 %C;First Jewish family show - The Goldberg's begin

%C; In %R;1951 %C;First jet passenger trip made

%C; In %R;1969 %C;USSR's Venera 6 launched for parachute landing on Venus

%C; In %R;1978 %C;Soyuz 27 is launched

%C; In %R;1642 %C;Isaac Newton is elected a member of Royal Society

%C; In %R;1787 %C;Titania & Oberon, moons of Uranus, discovered by William Herschel

%C; In %R;1813 %C;First pineapples planted in Hawaii.

%C; In %R;1935 %C;1st woman to fly solo across Pacific left Honolulu, AE Putnam

%C; In %R;1935 %C;Amelia Earhart flies from Hawaii to California, non-stop

%C; In %R;1975 %C;Soyuz 17 is launched

%

%B;Today is January 11th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1755 %C;Alexander Hamilton, the 1st Secretary of the US Treasury

%C; In %R;1807 %C;Ezra Cornell, founded Western Union Telegraph & Cornell Univ.

%C; In %R;1885 %C;Alice Paul, founder of National Woman's Party, ERA advocate

%C; In %R;1903 %C;Alan Paton, South African writer (Cry, the Beloved Country)

%C; In %R;1906 %C;Albert Hofmann, Swiss chemist, discoverer of LSD

%

%B;Today is January 12th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1588 %C;John Winthrop, 1st governor of the Massachusetts Bay Colony.

%C; In %R;1737 %C;John Hancock

%C; In %R;1876 %C;Jack London, writer (Call of the Wild, The Sea Wolf)

%Y;On this day...

%C; In %R;1777 %C;Mission Santa Clara de Asis founded in California

%C; In %R;1820 %C;Royal Astronomical Society, founded in England

%

%B;Today is January 13th, %YEAR%...

%C; In %R;1854 %C;Anthony Foss obtains patent for the Accordion.

%C; In %R;1986 %C;24th Space Shuttle Mission - Columbia 7 is launched

%C; In %R;1610 %C;Galileo Galilei discovers Callisto, 4th satellite of Jupiter

%C; In %R;1630 %C;Patent to Plymouth Colony issued

%C; In %R;1854 %C;Anthony Foss obtains patent for accordion

%C; In %R;1920 %C;NY Times Editorial says rockets can never fly.

%C; In %R;1930 %C;Mickey Mouse comic strip first appears

%C; In %R;1971 %C;Apollo 14 launched (what was that about rockets can't fly??)

%

%B;Today is January 14th, %YEAR%...

%Y;Happy Birthday to...

%C; In %R;1741 %C;Benedict Arnold, fink

%C; In %R;1791 %C;Calvin Phillips, became shortest known adult male (67 cm)

%C; In %R;1832 %C;Horatio Alger, Jr. American clergyman, author of boys' books

%C; In %R;1969 %C;Soyuz 4 is launched

%C; In %R;1850 %C;Sofya Kovalevskaya, Russian mathematician

%C; In %R;1759 %C;British Museum opens

%B;Today is January 16th, %YEAR%...

%C; In %R;1853 %C;Andre Michelin, French industrialist, tire manufacturer

%C; In %R;1883 %C;Pendleton Act creates basis of federal civil service system

%C; In %R;1887 %C;Cliff House badly damaged when a cargo of gunpowder on the

%C;schooner "Parallel" explodes nearby.

%C; In %R;1969 %C;Soviet Soyuz 4 & Soyuz 5 perform 1st transfer of crew in space

%C; In %R;1973 %C;USSR's Lunakhod begins radio-controlled exploration of moon

%C; In %R;1979 %C;Iranian revolution overthrows shah.

%C; In %R;1945 %C;Liberation Day in Poland (end of Nazi occupation)

%C; In %R;1942 %C;Muhammed Ali, who floats like a butterfly, stings like a bee.
